text: Why does Python assignment not return a value?
Why is Python assignment a statement rather than an expression?
If it was an expression which returns the value of the right hand side in the assignment, it would have allowed for much less verbose code in some cases.
Are there any issues I can't see?

code:
# lst is some sequence
# X is come class
x = X()
lst.append(x)

# incorrect: append is an assignment to a slice, so has no value
lst.append(x = X())
